bugs.description: The idle_seconds property will raise an AttributeError if next_run is None. The method calls (self.next_run - datetime.datetime.now()).total_seconds() without checking if next_run is None first. This can happen when no jobs are scheduled, causing the property to crash instead of handling the None case gracefully.

The __str__ method will raise an AttributeError when accessing job_func attributes if job_func is None or doesn't have the expected attributes. Lines 221-223 access self.job_func.__name__, self.job_func.args, and self.job_func.keywords without checking if job_func exists or if these attributes are available.

The run_pending method will raise a TypeError when sorting jobs if any job has next_run as None. Line 96 sorts runnable_jobs, but the Job.__lt__ method assumes next_run is not None, which can cause crashes during sorting.

The __repr__ method will raise an AttributeError when accessing job_func attributes if job_func is None. Lines 239-241 access self.job_func.args and self.job_func.keywords without checking if job_func exists, which can happen before the do() method is called.
